All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, ptolemy.actor.Actor, ptolemy.actor.Executable, ptolemy.actor.FiringsRecordable, ptolemy.actor.Initializable, ptolemy.actor.TypedActor, ptolemy.kernel.util.Changeable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Debuggable, ptolemy.kernel.util.DebugListener, ptolemy.kernel.util.Derivable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Instantiable, ptolemy.kernel.util.ModelErrorHandler, ptolemy.kernel.util.MoMLExportable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Moveable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Nameable
public class ColtExponentialPower
extends ColtRandomSource
Produce a random sequence with a ExponentialPower distribution. On each iteration, a new random number is produced. The output port is of type DoubleToken. The values that are generated are independent and identically distributed with the tau and the standard deviation given by parameters. In addition, the seed can be specified as a parameter to control the sequence that is generated.

This actor instantiates a cern.jet.random.ExponentialPower object with tau set to 1.0

Since:
Ptolemy II 4.1
Version:
$Id: ColtExponentialPower.java 57040 2010-01-27 20:52:32Z cxh $
Author:
David Bauer and Kostas Oikonomou
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • fire

      public void fire() throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Send a random number with a ExponentialPower distribution to the output. This number is only changed in the prefire() method, so it will remain constant throughout an iteration.
      Specified by:
      fire in interface ptolemy.actor.Executable
